text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
Changed title of IRM from Tax Exempt Bonds Bondholder Referrals to Tax Exempt Bonds Bondholder Identiﬁcation and Referral.
Added plain language edits to comply with the Plain Writing Act. For additional information on the Plain Writing Act, see http://www.plainlanguage.gov

IRM 4.81.7.2: Changed former section 4.81.7.1, Bondholder Referral in Adverse Bond Examinations to IRM 4.81.7.2, Establish Bondholder Case for Bond Examinations and added RCCMS case activity instructions.
IRM 4.81.7.3: Former section 4.81.7.2, Treatment of Bondholder Referrals updated and moved to IRM 4.81.7.3, Treatment of Bondholder Case.
Moved former section 4.81.7.4, Action when Final Adverse Determination Letter Issued, to IRM
Tax Exempt and Government Entities Government Entities Tax Exempt Bonds
Table of Contents
Bondholder Identiﬁcation and Referrals 4.81.7
) Purpose: This IRM section provides guidelines for TEB revenue agents (Examiners) and other staff to identify bondholders, extend statutes, and Scope and referrals to other operating divisions. (
) Audience: Examiners, tax law specialists, group managers, senior and other employees who examine or process Tax Exempt Bond (TEB) that may require identiﬁcation of the bondholders. (
) Policy Owner: Director, Exempt Organizations/Government Entities (
) Program Owner: Director, Exempt Organizations/Government Entities (
) All TEB examinations will be conducted in accordance with the Taxpayer Bill Rights and the Taxpayer First Act, consistent with the taxpayer rights in IRC Controls
) This manual uses the following acronyms and terms. Terms
All TEB examinations will be conducted in accordance with the Taxpayer Bill of Rights and the Taxpayer First Act, consistent with the taxpayer rights in IRC

Acronyms and Terms Description AIMS Audit Information Management Systems Examiner TEB Revenue Agent conducting examination Appeals IRS Independent Office of Appeals CDW Compliance Data Warehouse Coordinator TLS or TEB Revenue Agent assigned to perform the role as described herein. IDR Information Document Request IRC Internal Revenue Code RAAS Research, Applied Analytics & Statistics RCCMS Reporting Compliance Case Management System TEB Tax Exempt Bonds TEB Program Manager Program Manager, TEB TE/GE Tax Exempt and Government Entities TLS Tax Law Specialist
) The issuer of a bond isn’t liable for any taxes due on interest that becomes taxable as a result of a failure to meet the requirements for tax-exempt ﬁnancing under IRC
The bondholders who receive the interest payments are liable for any taxes due on such interest. Consequently, when appropriate, the IRS identiﬁes bondholders to collect tax liability. (
) Interest and principal payments on the bonds generally are not paid directly the issuer of the bonds to the bondholders. If there is a trustee/paying agent
Interest and principal payments on the bonds generally are not paid directly by the issuer of the bonds to the bondholders. If there is a trustee/paying agent
4.81 Tax Exempt Bonds (TEB) Examination and Procedures

for the issue, the trustee/paying agent often receives payments from the issuer and distributes payments to the bondholders. The trustee/paying agent may also distribute payments to a nominee. There may be several tiers of nominees between the trustee/paying agent and the bondholder (the beneﬁcial owner of the bonds) responsible for any tax on interest.

The Bondholder Case Notiﬁcation must be forwarded by e-mail through the Examiner’s Manager to the Coordinator (copy to the Coordinator’s Manager, different), and include the following, if applicable: a. A copy of the proposed adverse determination letter b. A copy of the explanation of items of the proposed adverse c. A listing of all outstanding maturities of the issue, including all CUSIP numbers d. The amount of interest paid on each interest payment date with respect to the issue for any open statute period e. A copy of detailed debt service schedule f. A copy of the series

information return ﬁled by the issuer g. A copy of the official statement, offering memorandum, or similar document for the issue h. The trustee’s and/or paying agent’s name, address, and contact person i. Contact information for the registrar or transfer agent of the issue, if any, who would have records of bond ownership j. A copy of the Examiner’s request for bondholder identiﬁcation by the of the bonds through use of an IDR and any response from the issuer k. A copy of the most recently issued notiﬁcation from the Examiner to the issuer regarding potential contact with third parties; as described in IRM
, Third Party Contact Information Speciﬁc to Tax Exempt Bonds. This would generally be either Letter
-K or Letter

l. A list of any bondholders identiﬁed during the examination, including all contact and ownership information available (name, EIN, address, and CUSIP number of bonds acquired). m. Any other information that would be useful in identifying the past and present bondholders of the issue. Within

days of receiving the Bondholder Case Notiﬁcation, the • Reviews it for completeness and requests any missing information the Examiner • Creates the bondholder case in RCCMS (but not on AIMS) • Requests establishment of the case. The Coordinator’s Manager approves establishment of the bondholder case. The RCCMS case activity should be established using the following a. Fill in TIN and NAME of the issuer. b. ) IRC
imposes limitations on disclosure of returns and return information but provides certain exceptions, including for certain tax administration purposes. (See IRM
, Disclosure of Official Information, General Rule and IRM
, Internet Research). The Coordinator must adhere to cable limitations on disclosure of returns and return information. (
) When contacting third parties following the procedures described in sections IRM
through IRM
, the Coordinator must verify the most recent

-day third-party contact notiﬁcation to the issuer is less than one old. If the notiﬁcation was issued more than one year prior to the third-party contact, the Coordinator must request the Examiner to issue a new to the issuer with a new waiting period of
days. (
) For any identiﬁed potential bondholders, the Coordinator will follow the dures in IRM
to conﬁrm details of the bond holdings. (

) The Coordinator will use the information in the Bondholder Case Notiﬁcation conduct research to identify potential bondholders using internal database for queries, such as with RAAS tools, and public information sources (subject to disclosure limitations). The Coordinator may require assistance of support personnel with access to certain systems and data in order to perform this research and will request such support through the Coordinator’s manager.
Identiﬁcation and Referrals 4.81.7
MFT: Use 46, except for MFT 85 (Form 8038-B) and MFT 86 (Form 8038-TC) when the issuer did not elect to receive direct payments.
(04-01-2020) Treatment of Bondholder Case

When contacting third parties following the procedures described in sections IRM 4.81.7.4 through IRM 4.81.7.6, the Coordinator must verify the most recent 45-day third-party contact notiﬁcation to the issuer is less than one year old. If the notiﬁcation was issued more than one year prior to the third-party contact, the Coordinator must request the Examiner to issue a new notiﬁcation to the issuer with a new waiting period of 45 days.
For any identiﬁed potential bondholders, the Coordinator will follow the dures in IRM 4.81.7.6 to conﬁrm details of the bond holdings.

The Coordinator will use the information in the Bondholder Case Notiﬁcation conduct research to identify potential bondholders using internal database queries, such as with RAAS tools, and public information sources (subject to disclosure limitations). The Coordinator may require assistance of support personnel with access to certain systems and data in order to perform this research and will request such support through the Coordinator’s manager.
Tax Exempt Bonds (TEB) Examination Program and Procedures
and Procedures (
) RAAS provides access to

-INT form data through use of the CDW By using CUSIP Numbers this tool can be useful in identifying bondholders. The CDW Tool currently requires the Coordinator to contact RAAS to request assistance in running TEB-related queries. The CDW Tool information about the bond issue including the affected CUSIP Numbers the impacted tax years. (
) The Securities and Exchange Commission’s Electronic Data Gathering, Analysis, and Retrieval system (EDGAR) database is also available to with bondholder identiﬁcation, as permitted under IRC
(c) and Treasury Regulation section
) when contacting governmental entities. (
) The Municipal Securities Rulemaking Board (MSRB) has several databases available that may also be used to assist with bondholder identiﬁcation. (

) The National Association of Insurance Commissioners (NAIC) maintains several databases including INSDATA and a comprehensive database its affiliate the National Insurance Producer Registry (NIPR) which provide formation on the bond holdings of insurance companies, including and CUSIP numbers. The NAIC is the U.S. standard-setting and regulatory support organization created and governed by the chief insurance from the
states, the District of Columbia and ﬁve U.S. territories. (

) The Bloomberg database can also provide some basic information about potential bondholders for a given bond issue. The search query uses commands to list current known holders and ﬁnd historical transactions that can be useful in identifying past bondholders. (

) The Coordinator may attempt to obtain bondholder information by sending a request letter to any identiﬁed third party. If information isn’t provided by the Contact of Third third party in response to the letter request, the Coordinator will elevate the to Identify issue to the TEB Program Manager for potential use of summonses to potential bondholders. (
) IRM

, the Summons Handbook, provides guidelines for use by TE/GE employees and covers topics including provisions of law, authority and to consider when issuing a Third-Party Summons or a John Doe Summons identify bondholders. Upon a determination by the TEB Program Manager use summonses to identify potential bondholders under paragraph (

) the Coordinator and the Examiner will brief their manager(s) on a plan to prepare, issue, and follow up on any summonses, as appropriate, and will implement the plan subject to adjustments based on input from their managers. (
) IRM
provides detailed guidelines for handling Third-Party and IRM
provides detailed guidelines for handling John Doe Summonses. (
) IRM
also provides information as a Legal Reference Guide for Officers, Summonses about basic legal concepts governing the use and en- forcement of administrative summonses.
IRM 25.5.6 provides detailed guidelines for handling Third-Party Summonses and IRM 25.5.7 provides detailed guidelines for handling John Doe

The Coordinator will review the AMDISA and such other internal systems information as necessary to determine whether the return periods during which conﬁrmed bondholder the bonds are under exam by another operating division. (

) If a conﬁrmed bondholder’s return for the applicable return periods is under examination, the Coordinator will request direction from management on whether to submit a referral to the operating division examining the return. Upon making such a referral, the Coordinator will coordinate with the examining operating division to provide information necessary to propose the adjustment to income. (See IRM
for Referral Procedures.) (
) If a conﬁrmed bondholder’s return for the applicable return periods is not examination, the Coordinator will mail the bondholder Letter

including: copies of the proposed or ﬁnal adverse determination letter, as applicable, information on available resolution options, and (iii) requests for restricted consents for statute extension related to open statute years. See Letter Proposed Adverse Transmittal Letter. (

) Upon the issuance of a ﬁnal adverse determination, the Coordinator will identify potential statute expiration dates for identiﬁed bondholders and with management on next steps on requests for additional consents for extensions or referrals to other operating divisions. (
) The Coordinator may periodically repeat the search process to determine sequent transfers as directed by management.
Bondholder Identiﬁcation and Referrals
The Coordinator will correspond with potential bondholder(s) identiﬁed under IRM
(by the Examiner), IRM
(through electronic research and contacts), and IRM

(through written contact with third parties) to conﬁrm the amount of bonds held and holding period(s) as described below. Generally, such correspondence with potential bondholders will not begin prior to the issuance of a ﬁnal adverse determination except as directed by the TEB Program Manager.

The Coordinator will correspond with potential bondholder(s) identiﬁed under IRM 4.81.7.2 (by the Examiner), IRM 4.81.7.4 (through electronic research and contacts), and IRM 4.81.7.5 (through written contact with third parties) to conﬁrm the amount of bonds held and holding period(s) as described below. Generally, such correspondence with potential bondholders will not begin prior to the issuance of a ﬁnal adverse determination except as directed by the TEB Program Manager.

, Bondholder Conﬁrmation Letter is issued by the Coordinator to conﬁrm the potential bondholder’s ownership interest. Letter

The Coordinator may periodically repeat the search process to determine sequent transfers as directed by management.
Tax Exempt Bonds (TEB) Examination and Procedures (

) The Coordinator, upon direction from the TEB Program Manager, may take steps to control statutes on returns of identiﬁed bondholders. Generally, the Coordinator will follow the Statute Control procedures in IRM
when controlling statutes. (

) If a conﬁrmed bondholder requests a closing agreement to resolve its tax liability resulting from an adverse determination (rather than ﬁling an of priate return), TEB may consider such request subject to applicable Request for jurisdictional limitations. Generally, such a closing agreement would be based on the bondholder’s tax liability related to interest on the bond issue. (
) If TEB agrees to the closing agreement, the Coordinator will prepare a agreement following procedures similar to the TEB closing agreement proce- dures under IRM
) When the bondholder identiﬁcation process starts after the adverse tion becomes ﬁnal, skip paragraphs (
) through (

) below and move forward Final with referrals except to the extent bondholders resolve outstanding tax liabili- Determination ties related to the bonds pursuant to a closing agreement as provided in IRM
or by ﬁling appropriate tax returns. (

) When a ﬁnal adverse determination letter is issued at the group level, the manager will forward a copy of the letter to the Coordinator’s Manager. If a ﬁnal adverse letter is issued by Appeals, a copy will be provided to the nator’s Manager. (
) The Coordinator’s Manager will forward a copy of the ﬁnal adverse tion letter to the Coordinator. (
) The Coordinator will obtain AMDISA for taxpayer identiﬁcation numbers of conﬁrmed bondholders and determine whether those return periods are examination by another operating division. (
) For bondholders that are regulated investment companies, within the of IRC
, the Coordinator with the approval of their manager will make a referral of the bondholder to the appropriate operating division following the procedures starting in paragraph (
) of this section. (

) If a conﬁrmed bondholder’s return for the applicable return periods is under examination, the Coordinator will make a referral to another operating by contacting the manager of the group conducting the examination of the bondholder. Examiner with assistance of the Coordinator will coordinate with the examining group to provide information necessary to propose the adjust- ment to income resulting from the adverse determination. See IRM
for Referral Procedures. (
) If a conﬁrmed bondholder’s return for the applicable return periods is not under examination, the Coordinator will send copies of the ﬁnal adverse mination letter if not previously sent (see IRM
)) to the bondholder and make a referral to another operating division, subject to approval from their manager. See Letter
, Final Adverse Transmittal Letter. See also
for Referral Procedures.
Tax Exempt Bonds (TEB) Examination Program and Procedures
Identiﬁcation and Referrals 4.81.7
) The Coordinator may determine the trustee or paying agent is required to issue Forms
for interest to any bondholders or nominees. In the where a trustee or paying agent is required to issue Forms
for the Coordinator will notify the trustee or paying agent by issuing Letter Trustee Notiﬁcation Letter, through certiﬁed mail. Generally, ﬁnancial tions are not required to issue Forms
to bondholders that are corporations or nominees such as Cede & Co. (nominee name for the tory Trust Company (DTC)). (
) The Coordinator will review MSRB databases for information or tions provided by the trustee or paying agent to the bondholders or as a result of the ﬁnal adverse determination. (
) The Coordinator may determine a nominee is required to issue Forms interest to any bondholders. The Coordinator will notify bondholder required to issue Forms
for interest of the ﬁnal adverse and request delinquent or corrected information returns by issuing Letter Trustee Notiﬁcation Letter. (

) The Coordinator requests closure of the bondholder case within RCCMS concurrence from management after notiﬁed bondholders: a. resolved their tax liability by ﬁling the required tax returns or a closing agreement, or b. have been referred to the appropriate operating division. (
) Referrals to other operating divisions are completed by the Coordinator. referral procedures in IRM
, How to Prepare a Referral; IRM
, How to Transmit Referrals to Another Office/Function; and IRM
, Referrals to Other IRS Functions/Government Agencies. (
) When bond examinations within the jurisdiction of Appeals are resolved issuance of a ﬁnal adverse determination letter, the TEB Program notify the Coordinator’s Manager. (

) The Coordinator’s Manager will notify the Coordinator that the issue was resolved in Appeals. The Coordinator must notify any identiﬁed that have been contacted that the case has been closed by issuing Letter , Bondholder No Change Advisory Letter. (
) The Coordinator must then include all correspondence in the RCCMS and request closure of the bondholder case within RCCMS.
The Coordinator requests closure of the bondholder case within RCCMS concurrence from management after notiﬁed bondholders:
(04-01-2020) Post Appeals Action when Bonds Remain Tax-Exempt
The Coordinator must then include all correspondence in the RCCMS case ﬁle and request closure of the bondholder case within RCCMS.
